intro: Alyxia markgrafiana, commonly known as the pink-flowered alyxia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its showy, pink or red flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom during the summer months. Alyxia markgrafiana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display.
